text: Consider the following statements: 1. The set Q x Z is uncountable. Il. The set { f : f is a function from N to {0, 1}} is uncountable. IIl. The set { /B : pis a prime number } is uncountable. IV. For any infinite set, there exists a bijection from the set to one of its proper subsets. (Qiis the set of all rational numbers, Z is the set of all integers and N is the set of all natural numbers) Which of the above statements are TRUE? A.land IV only B. lland IV only C. Il and Il only D. I, Il and IV only
